title: Bugsy Siegel
summary: Benjamin "Bugsy" Siegel (February 28, 1906 â€“ June 20, 1947) was an American mobster[2] who was a driving force behind the development of the Las Vegas Strip.[3] Siegel not only was influential within the Jewish Mob but, along with his friend and fellow gangster Meyer Lansky, also held significant influence within the Italian-American Mafia and the largely Italian-Jewish National Crime Syndicate. Described as handsome and charismatic, he became one of the first front-page celebrity gangsters.[4]
